title: There is / There are
description: Describe existence or presence of things using singular and plural.

subtopics.title: Affirmative Uses
subtopics.description: State that something exists in a place.

examples.sample: There is a cat on the roof.

examples.explanation: Use with more than one item.
examples.sample: There are three chairs in the room.

subtopics.title: Questions and Negatives
subtopics.description: Ask or say that something does not exist.

examples.sample: Is there a bank near here?

examples.explanation: Negative forms for singular and plural.

exercises.instruction: Rewrite in the plural form using 'there are'.
exercises.sentence: There is a book on the table.
exercises.expected: There are books on the table.
